poem:
A Second Term  

The ink dries; truth distorts,  
a narrative sculpted,  
chiseled from violence's stone.  
Old echoes of chaos  
find refuge in quiet whispers,  
pardons granted,  
words like salves  
on wounded histories.  
In this world of second chances,  
a new day dawns,  
its light slightly bent,  
shadows growing longer.
